item.title: E.ON Warns of Earnings Hit From Price Reductions
item.description: E.ON said it expected fourth-quarter earnings to suffer the impact of price reductions for electricity and gas customers, but confirmed its full-year guidance and said it planned to invest more than €6 billion in 2023.

item.title: Declining Liquidity Adds to Fluctuations in Eurozone Government-Bond Markets
item.description: Swift fluctuations in eurozone government-bond markets these days are probably exacerbated by the fact that liquidity is starting to decline as the end of the year is approaching, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Bayer Mulls Possible Split of Crops or Consumer Health
item.description: Bayer CEO Bill Anderson said he is looking at various structural options for the company but ruled out splitting the group into three businesses.

item.title: Democratic Gov. Beshear won re-election in Kentucky, and Democrats in Virginia prevented full Republican control of the state government.
item.description: Democratic Gov. Beshear won re-election in Kentucky, and Democrats in Virginia prevented full Republican control of the state government.

item.title: Police are investigating the death of a 69-year-old Jewish man as a possible homicide following an altercation at dual pro-Israeli and pro-Palestinian demonstrations near Los Angeles.
item.description: Police are investigating the death of a 69-year-old Jewish man as a possible homicide following an altercation at dual pro-Israeli and pro-Palestinian demonstrations near Los Angeles.

item.title: Goldman plans to begin a process to unload its GM credit-card program in another step away from its failed foray into consumer lending.
item.description: Goldman plans to begin a process to unload its GM credit-card program in another step away from its failed foray into consumer lending.

item.title: U.S. banks are selling complex debt instruments to private-fund managers as a way to reduce regulatory capital charges on the loans they make, people familiar with the transactions said.
item.description: U.S. banks are selling complex debt instruments to private-fund managers as a way to reduce regulatory capital charges on the loans they make, people familiar with the transactions said.

item.title: Rivian raised its production forecast for the year and said losses narrowed in the third quarter, as the EV startup tries to increase output after a choppy two-year launch.
item.description: Rivian raised its production forecast for the year and said losses narrowed in the third quarter, as the EV startup tries to increase output after a choppy two-year launch.

item.title: Ohio voters decided to enshrine abortion rights in the state's constitution, the latest test of where voters stand on one of the most consequential issues heading into next year's presidential election.
item.description: Ohio voters decided to enshrine abortion rights in the state’s constitution, the latest test of where voters stand on one of the most consequential issues heading into next year’s presidential election.

item.title: Automakers and dealers are slashing prices of electric vehicles and piling on discounts to clear out unsold inventory as sales growth has slowed for battery-powered models.
item.description: Automakers and dealers are slashing prices of electric vehicles and piling on discounts to clear out unsold inventory as sales growth has slowed for battery-powered models.

item.title: Japanese automakers selling fewer EVs in China are looking at whether to cut their losses and focus resources on warding off Chinese rivals in other markets.
item.description: Japanese automakers selling fewer EVs in China are looking at whether to cut their losses and focus resources on warding off Chinese rivals in other markets.

item.title: A physicist whose burgeoning career has been rocked by accusations of plagiarism and professional misconduct had his biggest discovery invalidated by the journal that published the research.
item.description: A physicist whose burgeoning career has been rocked by accusations of plagiarism and professional misconduct had his biggest discovery invalidated by the journal that published the research.

item.title: Supreme Court justices showed little sympathy for a violent domestic abuser arguing he had a Second Amendment right to keep firearms at home, in arguments over the scope of a 2022 precedent holding gun regulations unconstitutional unless they are analogous to those in force in the founding era.
item.description: Supreme Court justices showed little sympathy for a violent domestic abuser arguing he had a Second Amendment right to keep firearms at home, in arguments over the scope of a 2022 precedent holding gun regulations unconstitutional unless they are analogous to those in force in the founding era.

item.title: Israel said it intends to retain security control of Gaza for an indefinite period once its war with Hamas ends, prompting U.S. officials to stress their opposition to a reoccupation of the enclave.
item.description: Israel said it intends to retain security control of Gaza for an indefinite period once its war with Hamas ends, prompting U.S. officials to stress their opposition to a reoccupation of the enclave.

item.title: China's housing slump is shaking the foundation of giant property developer Vanke and the government is trying to prevent the problems from spiraling out of control.
item.description: China’s housing slump is shaking the foundation of giant property developer Vanke and the government is trying to prevent the problems from spiraling out of control.

item.title: The U.S. and its NATO allies served notice that they will formally suspend their participation in a 1990 treaty limiting conventional forces in Europe, marking the demise of another landmark arms-control agreement.
item.description: The U.S. and its NATO allies served notice that they will formally suspend their participation in a 1990 treaty limiting conventional forces in Europe, marking the demise of another landmark arms-control agreement.

item.title: China has become a losing proposition for Wall Street firms, forcing them to reassess their investment-banking prospects in Hong Kong.
item.description: China has become a losing proposition for Wall Street firms, forcing them to reassess their investment-banking prospects in Hong Kong.

item.title: A U.S. stock rally continued, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 0.3%, 0.9% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: A U.S. stock rally continued, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 0.3%, 0.9% and 0.2%, respectively.

item.title: German Inflation Confirmed at 3.8%
item.description: German inflation fell in October to its lowest rate since August 2021, eased down by weaker energy prices, another indication the ECB may have reached the peak in its current rate-hiking cycle.

item.title: Adidas on Track Despite Weaker Third Quarter
item.description: Adidas posted weaker third-quarter results as expected and confirmed its recently updated guidance for 2023.
